de.polygonal.ds.Map<K, T>

type
interface
implements
Collection<T>

An object that maps keys to values.

This map allows duplicate keys.

Instance Methods

clr(key : K) : Bool

returns
true if key was successfully removed, false if key does not exist.
Removes a key/value pair.

get(key : K) : T

Returns the element that is mapped to key or a special value (see implementation) indicating that key does not exist.

has(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this map contains a mapping for the element x.

hasKey(key : K) : Bool

Returns true if this map contains key.

keys() : Itr<K>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Creates and returns an iterator over all keys in this map.

remap(key : K, x : T) : Bool

returns
true if the remapping was successful, false if key does not exist.
Remaps the first occurrence of key to the element x.
This is faster than clr(key) followed by set(key, x).

set(key : K, x : T) : Bool

returns
true if key was added for the first time, false if this key is not unique.
Multiple keys are stored in a First-In-First-Out (FIFO) order - there is no way to access keys which were added after the first key, other than removing the first key which unveals the second key.
Maps the element x to key.

toKeySet() : Set<K>

Returns a set view of the keys contained in this map.

toValSet() : Set<T>

Returns a set view of the elements contained in this map.
